title: HTMLExercises

metadata.description: Learn about HTMLExercises with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Exercises
Test your HTML skills with exercises from all categories:
Introduction
Basic
Elements

Favicon

Ordered Lists

Responsive

Entities

Input Types
Input Attributes
Input Form Attributes

If you haven't already,

to become a W3Schooler, and get points for every exercise you complete.
As a logged-in  user you will have access to many features like having
your own web page
,
track your learning progress
,
receive personal guided paths
, and
more
.
The Exercise
The exercises are a mix of "multiple choice" and "fill in the blanks" questions. 
There are between 3 and 9 questions in each category.
The answer can be found in the corresponding tutorial chapter. If you're stuck, 
or answer wrong, you can try again or hit the "Show Answer" button to see the correct answer.

summary: This tutorial covers HTMLExercises concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use HTMLExercises effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of HTMLExercises and how to apply it in your projects.
